Situation Report
-3
The Ford Foundation feels that establishing the single voice
for public television (which it equates with all of public
broadcasting) is essential to its continuing involvement.
It is counting on Rogers' group to secure the guaranteed
access to the interconnection; without such a guarantee, it
cannot go ahead with funding any programs. If the new entity
is established, I am assured that NAEB's activities will be
assisted, whether we join in a formal merger or remain an
independent professional society. Ford is officially
inscrutable, but my impression is that we could count on
suPPort for an adjustment period of as long as three years.
